content:
The problem with small world becomes abundantly apparent almost 
immediately. It doesn't matter how many computer players you pick to play 
against; it's not computer bot vs bot vs bot vs you. It's the entire 
computer vs you. The bots don't ever target a fellow bot. They always 
target you. That's not how strategy works and that's not how a game would 
go with multiple human players. You'd go after the person in the lead, or 
the strategic advantage. Small world's AI simply isn't smart enough. As 
long as you know that you'll never truly get a fair, accurate portrayal of 
human vs human game, you'll probably be ok. Just know, you will be 
frustrated. It's not cheating by the computer, just bad AI design. And that 
daily lies entirely with lazy programmers.

Small World is my number one favorite board game, so naturally I was interested when I heard that there was a Kickstarter to bring the game to Android. Now that it is out I can say this is the best board game on Android. Period.   For those whom never played the game. Small World is a very light war strategy game where each player picks one race. But, with each new game a special power is paired with each race. The combination determines what the size of the army it will be at the beginning and what two powers it will be allowed to use during the game. This makes each game almost different everytime you play. When your race becomes useless you can decline that race and pick a new one.  The app it self is well designed, loads up quickly on my Samsung Tab 2, easy to use, and pretty to look at. You can solo against a tough AI (at least to me), go online against random player or against your buddies (works with Steam and iOS players). Or, use your Droid to play a hot seat game offline.The 3 other expansions that you can purchase adds even more fun to the game.   I highly recommend this game!! Go!! And, crush your enemies!
